p: From the organization of protests to the mainstreaming of public awareness around the climate crisis through social media, engaging in community action, and filing lawsuits, young people have solidified themselves as pioneers in applying a human rights approach to climate change while highlighting the health and social impacts of climate change [61]. These examples demonstrate some of the ways in which young people are attempting change within their own communities, to ensure their rights are upheld, and inspiring novel approaches to climate policies. This can lay the foundations to further pursue intersectional approaches to addressing the climate crisis.
